text:
I have 6 fo:block-container. 3 at the left side of the page with text-
align="start" and 3 at the right side of the page with text-align="end". So it 
looks a little bit as a 3x2 table. Problem: if there is a certain space between 
the left and the right objects, the text-align="end" doesn't seem to work 
properly. The three objects at the right side have exactely the same horizontal 
position and also the same widht in the fo-file. But in the pdf-file one object 
is placed at the wrong position! It moves a little bit to the left. So this 
doesn't look nice if all objects should be "right-aligned".
creator: matthias.wetter@pendia.ch
matthias.wetter@pendia.ch
text:
Created attachment 14252
sample to the bug-description

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
I can't see the problem in the test FO you attached. Maybe you have a 
different test file where the problem happened. Alignment problems can happen 
if you're using a font with kerning information. If you remove the kerning 
elements from the font metric XML the problem should go away.

Gruss aus Luzern :-)
Fixed in FOP 0.94 and probably earlier versions
creator: pascal.sancho@takoma.fr

text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
